intro: Terebinthus excelsa, commonly known as the tall terebinth, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spiky fruits. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its resin has historically been used for medicinal and aromatic purposes.
